answers.a: Larch arabinogalactan is a plant-derived polysaccharide (soluble dietary fiber) extracted from larch trees (Larix spp.), used as food additive E409 for stabilization/thickening and as a prebiotic fiber.

answers.q: 90 e409 trans hunting for gear when on constant throttle
answers.a: E409 is the food additive code for arabinogalactan and is unrelated to vehicle transmissions—you may be thinking of the E4OD transmission.

answers.q: 90 ford f350 e409 trans hunting for gear when on constant throttle
answers.a: E409 refers to the food additive arabinogalactan, not an automotive transmission; the Ford transmission you likely mean is the E4OD.

It occurs naturally in larch wood and in plant gums like gum arabic and gum ghatti; in the food supply, it’s present when added as E409 to products such as beverages, confections, dairy, and sauces as a stabilizer/soluble fiber.
Follow product directions; a common supplemental amount is about 4–10 g per day mixed into water or food, starting lower to reduce gas and bloating and drinking adequate fluids.
